wikipedia_page.main: Charles John Lyttelton, 10th Viscount Cobham,  (8 August 1909 – 20 March 1977) was the ninth Governor-General of New Zealand and an English cricketer from the Lyttelton family.

response: *1909 – Charles Lyttelton, 10th Viscount Cobham, English cricketer and politician, 9th Governor-General of New Zealand (d. 1977)
*1959 – The Auckland Harbour Bridge, crossing the Waitemata Harbour in Auckland, New Zealand, is officially opened by Governor-General Charles Lyttelton, 10th Viscount Cobham.
* March 20 – Charles Lyttelton, 10th Viscount Cobham, English politician, 9th Governor-General of New Zealand (b. 1909)

response: *Charles Lyttelton, 10th Viscount Cobham (1909–1977), Governor General of New Zealand and English cricketer; captain of Worcestershire in the 1930s
